dcterms:description: The LRW database consists of short segments (1.16 seconds) from BBC programs, mainly news and talk shows. It is a very challenging dataset since it contains more than 1000 speakers and large variations in head pose and illumination. For each target word, it has a training set of 1000 segments, a validation and an evaluation set of 50 segments each. The total duration of this corpus is 173 hours. The corpus with 500 words is also much larger than previous lip-reading databases used for word recognition.
dcterms:title: LRW

dcterms:description: LRW-1000 is a challenging Mandarin lip-reading dataset due to its large variations in scale, resolution, background clutter, and speaker attributes. The speakers are mostly interviewers, broadcasters, program guests, and so on. The dataset consists of 1000 word classes and has 718,018 samples, totaling 57 hours. The minimum and maximum length of the samples are about 0.01 seconds and 2.25 seconds respectively, with an average of about 0.3 seconds for each sample.
dcterms:title: LRW-1000
